data.enText: considered and judged by being compared with sth else
the relative merits of the two plans
data.chText: 相比较之下两个计划各自的优点

data.enText: considered according to its position or connection with sth else
the position of the sun relative to the earth
data.chText: 太阳与地球的相对位置

data.enText: that exists or that has a particular quality only when compared with sth else
They now live in relative comfort (= compared with how they lived before) .
data.chText: 他们现在过得比较舒适。

data.enText: Given the failure of the previous plan, this turned out to be a relative success.
data.chText: 由于前面那个计划失败了，这个计划算是比较成功的。

data.enText: It's all relative though, isn't it? We never had any money when I was a kid and $500 was a fortune to us.
data.chText: 不过，一切都是相对的，是不是？我小的时候，我们根本没有钱，500块钱对于我们来说就是很大的一笔财富了。

data.enText: having a connection with sth; referring to sth
the facts relative to the case
data.chText: 与这个案件有关的事实

data.enText: referring to an earlier noun, sentence or part of a sentence
data.chText: （指代前面的名词、句子或句子的一部分）

data.enText: In ‘the man who came’, ‘who’ is a relative pronoun and ‘who came’ is a relative clause .
data.chText: 在the man who came中，who是关系代词，而who came是关系从句。

data.enText: a person who is in the same family as sb else
a thing that belongs to the same group as sth else
The ibex is a distant relative of the mountain goat.
data.chText: 北山羊与石山羊有较远的亲缘关系。

simple_means.memory_skill: relate 联系,关联 + -ive 形容词后缀

tr: an animal or plant that bears a relationship to another (as related by common descent or by membership in the same genus)
a person related by blood or marriage
example: police are searching for relatives of the deceased
he has distant relations back in New Jersey

tr: properly related in size or degree or other measurable characteristics
example: the punishment ought to be proportional to the crime

example.ex: Do relatives of yours still live in Siberia?...
example.tran: 你的亲属仍然住在西伯利亚吗？

example.ex: Get a relative to look after the children.
example.tran: 找一个亲戚来照看孩子。

value.def: Your relatives are the members of your family.

example.ex: The fighting resumed after a period of relative calm...
example.tran: 战斗在相对平静的一段时间之后再次打响。

example.ex: It is a cancer that can be cured with relative ease...
example.tran: 这是一种相对来说比较容易治疗的癌症。

example.ex: Pedestrian zones mean that children can play in relative safety.
example.tran: 步行区域意味着孩子们可以在那里相对安全地玩耍。

value.def: You use relative to say that something is true to a certain degree, especially when compared with other things of the same kind.

example.ex: They chatted about the relative merits of London and Paris as places to live...
example.tran: 他们聊起了伦敦和巴黎两座城市相比较都有哪些宜居的优点。

example.ex: I reflected on the relative importance of education in 50 countries.
example.tran: 我思考了50个国家相对而言对教育的重视程度。

example.ex: ...the relative strength of the central and state governments.
example.tran: 中央政府和州政府的相对力量

value.def: You use relative when you are comparing the quality or size of two things.

example.ex: Japanese interest rates rose relative to America's...
example.tran: 日本利率随美国利率上浮。

example.ex: House prices now look cheap relative to earnings...
example.tran: 相对收入而言房价现在看起来比较便宜。

example.ex: The satellite remains in one spot relative to the earth's surface.
example.tran: 相对地球表面而言，这颗卫星位置固定。

value.def: Relative to something means with reference to it or in comparison with it.
value.tran: 与…相比;与…有关;涉及;关于

example.ex: Fitness is relative; one must always ask 'Fit for what?'...
example.tran: “适合”是相对而言的;应该常常问一问“适合什么？”

value.def: If you say that something is relative, you mean that it needs to be considered and judged in relation to other things.

example.ex: The pheasant is a close relative of the Guinea hen.
example.tran: 雉与珍珠鸡有很近的亲缘关系。

value.def: If one animal, plant, language, or invention is a relative of another, they have both developed from the same type of animal, plant, language, or invention.
value.tran: 亲缘动物（或植物、语言、发明等)

trans: 相對速度；相对速度；称为相对速度；绝对速度；相对运动
相对磁导率；相对渗透率；相对导磁率；相對磁導率；相对导磁系数
相对孔径；相对口径；相对光圈

partsOfSpeech.dec: act 行动,做 + -ive 形容词后缀
attract v.引来 + -ive 形容词后缀
creat(e) 创造 + -ive 形容词后缀
expens(e) 费用 + -ive 形容词后缀
pass 走,跨过 + -ive 形容词后缀
ad- 加强 + ject 投掷,扔 + -ive 形容词后缀
aggress vi.攻击 + -ive 形容词后缀
alternate 轮流,(使)交替 + -ive 形容词后缀
at- 加强 + tent 伸展 + -ive 形容词后缀
collect v.收集 + -ive 形容词后缀
com- 共同, 一起 + prehend 抓, 抓住 + -ive 形容词后缀
effect n.结果 + -ive 形容词后缀
ex- 出,出去 + cess 行走,撤退 + -ive 形容词后缀
execut(e) 执行 + -ive 形容词后缀
ex- 出,出去 + tens 伸展 + -ive 形容词后缀
impress v.使（人）赞赏尊敬 + -ive 形容词后缀

partsOfSpeech.d: 短时间内集中紧张进行的
partsOfSpeech.dec: intens(e) 高度的,极度的 + -ive 形容词后缀
posit 放 + -ive 形容词后缀
pro- 向前,在前 + duct 引导 + -ive 形容词后缀
progress n.前进 + -ive 形容词后缀
protect v.保护 + -ive 形容词后缀
re- 相对,相反 + spect 看 + -ive 形容词后缀
suc- 在...下面 + cess- 走开;撤退 + -ive 形容词后缀
destruct v.毁坏 + -ive 形容词后缀
co- 共同,一起 + oper- 工作 + -ate 做,造成 + -ive 形容词后缀
ex- 出,出去 + clus 关闭 + -ive 形容词后缀
con- 共同,一起 + secut 跟随 + -ive 形容词后缀
prospect n.未来事件发生的可能性 + -ive 形容词后缀
in- 在内,进入,使 + clus 关闭 + -ive 形容词后缀
de- 离开,向下 + cis 切,割 + -ive 形容词后缀
initiat(e) 入会 + -ive 形容词后缀

partsOfSpeech.d: 大量的，巨大的，大规模的
partsOfSpeech.dec: mass 大量 + -ive 形容词后缀
narrat(e) 叙述 + -ive 形容词后缀
in- 在内,进入,使 + cent 唱,歌 + -ive 形容词后缀
subject n.题目 + -ive 形容词后缀
per- 完全 + spect- 看 + -ive 形容词后缀
indicat(e) 指示 + -ive 形容词后缀
